abstract: General Electric has reduced the cost of making O.L.E.Ds, the electronics that might one day enable flexible and energy-efficient TVs that can be rolled up and carried around. It makes its O.L.E.D.s with flexible plastic, which can run through a printing press, drastically reducing the cost of manufacturing the devices for use in lighting.

lead_paragraph: Print publications are migrating to the Internet, but it seems lighting is migrating to the printing press.

headline.main: A Light Bulb Went Off: Print the Lights
